Additional Materials: Electronic calculator  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 390, 388, 407]]<|/det|>
## READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 416, 719, 432]]<|/det|>
Write your Centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 432, 320, 446]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 446, 504, 461]]<|/det|>
You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 460, 504, 475]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 475, 380, 490]]<|/det|>
DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 501, 282, 516]]<|/det|>
Answer all the questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 515, 828, 545]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place in the case of angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 544, 593, 559]]<|/det|>
The use of an electronic calculator is expected, where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 559, 604, 574]]<|/det|>
You are reminded of the need for clear presentation in your answers.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 584, 604, 599]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 599, 759, 614]]<|/det|>
The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 614, 437, 629]]<|/det|>
The total number of marks for this paper is 80.

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[398, 73, 599, 91]]<|/det|>
Mathematical Formulae  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[437, 164, 561, 182]]<|/det|>
## 1. ALGEBRA  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 195, 240, 213]]<|/det|>
Quadratic Equation  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 225, 383, 244]]<|/det|>
For the equation \(a x^{2} + b x + c = 0\)  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[423, 243, 574, 284]]<|/det|>
\[x = \frac{-b\pm\sqrt{b^{2} - 4ac}}{2a}\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 315, 228, 333]]<|/det|>
Binomial Theorem  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[242, 336, 754, 377]]<|/det|>
\[(a + b)^{n} = a^{n} + \binom{n}{1} a^{n - 1}b + \binom{n}{2} a^{n - 2}b^{2} + \ldots +\binom{n}{r} a^{n - r}b^{r} + \ldots +b^{n},\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 384, 494, 420]]<|/det|>
where \(n\) is a positive integer and \(\binom{n}{r} = \frac{n!}{(n - r)!r!}\)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[401, 483, 594, 502]]<|/det|>
## 2. TRIGONOMETRY  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 516, 156, 534]]<|/det|>
Identities  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[420, 545, 580, 615]]<|/det|>
\[\sin^{2}A + \cos^{2}A = 1\] \[\sec^{2}A = 1 + \tan^{2}A\] \[\csc \mathrm{e}^{2}A = 1 + \cot^{2}A\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 643, 242, 662]]<|/det|>
Formulae for \(\Delta ABC\)  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[405, 667, 590, 700]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{a}{\sin A} = \frac{b}{\sin B} = \frac{c}{\sin C}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[401, 719, 593, 740]]<|/det|>
\[a^{2} = b^{2} + c^{2} - 2bc\cos A\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[438, 747, 558, 777]]<|/det|>
\[\Delta = \frac{1}{2} bc\sin A\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 75, 692, 92]]<|/det|>
If \(z = 2 + \sqrt{3}\) find the integers \(a\) and \(b\) such that \(az^{2} + bz = 1 + \sqrt{3}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 75, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 72, 92, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 71, 920, 121]]<|/det|>
Naomi is going on holiday and intends to read 4 books during her time away. She selects these books from 5 mystery, 3 crime and 2 romance books. Find the number of ways in which she can make her selection in each of the following cases.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 133, 141, 152]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 133, 353, 152]]<|/det|>
There are no restrictions.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 133, 920, 152]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 210, 141, 229]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 210, 442, 229]]<|/det|>
She selects at least 2 mystery books.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 210, 920, 229]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[106, 564, 141, 583]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 564, 467, 583]]<|/det|>
She selects at least 1 book of each type.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 564, 920, 583]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 71, 94, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 69, 744, 91]]<|/det|>
The volume of a closed cylinder of base radius \(x\) cm and height \(h\) cm is \(500 \mathrm{cm}^3\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 102, 143, 120]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 101, 343, 120]]<|/det|>
Express \(h\) in terms of \(x\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 102, 920, 120]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 225, 143, 244]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 222, 809, 247]]<|/det|>
Show that the total surface area of the cylinder is given by \(A = 2\pi x^2 + \frac{1000}{x} \mathrm{cm}^2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 227, 920, 245]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[106, 412, 141, 429]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 411, 870, 432]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 412, 920, 431]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 75, 856, 102]]<|/det|>

<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 111, 826, 133]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 515, 210, 534]]<|/det|>
\(x = 4\).
